cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper studies the inefficiency of equilibria in various classes of games, which is a topic in game theory (cs.GT). The models used in the paper involve convex combinations and smooth interpolation, which are concepts commonly used in optimization and mathematical programming (cs.DS). The paper also discusses the impact of altruistic behavior on the price of anarchy, which is a topic in artificial intelligence and social networks (cs.AI, cs.SI). Finally, the paper derives bounds on the price of anarchy using a smoothness notion, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning and optimization (cs.LG).
